name: biomni-analyze-radiolabeled-antibody-biodistribution
title: Biomni: Analyze Radiolabeled Antibody Biodistribution
description: Analyzes radiolabeled antibody biodistribution across tissues
content:
Overview

Analyzes radiolabeled antibody biodistribution across tissues over time, essential for therapeutic antibody development and radioimmunotherapy applications. Quantifies tissue uptake, clearance kinetics, and target engagement.

Input Parameters

  • time_points (required): List of time points for biodistribution measurements (hours or days post-injection)
  • tissue_data (required): Dictionary of tissue types with corresponding radioactivity measurements (% ID/g or similar units)

Biological Use Case

Critical for antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) and radioimmunotherapy development. Enables optimization of antibody pharmacokinetics, assessment of tumor targeting efficiency, and evaluation of off-target accumulation in normal tissues for safety profiling.

Output

Biodistribution analysis including tissue uptake curves, tumor-to-blood ratios, clearance rates, and optimal imaging timepoints saved to biodistribution_results.txt

Category

pharmacology
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/pharmacology/analyze_radiolabeled_antibody_biodistribution.py --time-points "${timePoints}" --tissue-data "${tissueData}" -o "${outputDir}"

spec.name: timePoints
spec.label: Time Points

spec.label: Tissue Data
spec.description: Dictionary of tissue types with radioactivity measurements (JSON object, e.g., {"tumor": [2.5, 5.8], "liver": [8.2, 6.5]})
